VEC.Q: How many slices are there in this pie chart?
VEC.A: There are {6} slices in this pie chart.

SRP.Q: In the pie chart, what is the next slice in the clockwise direction from slice Oats?
SRP.A: The next slice clockwise from slice Oats is {Wheat}.

SRP.Q: In the pie chart, what is the next slice in the counterclockwise direction from slice Oats?
SRP.A: The next slice counterclockwise from slice Oats is {Barley}.

VPR.Q: Which crop has the largest proportion in this pie chart?
VPR.A: The crop with the largest proportion is {Rice}.

VPR.Q: Which crop has the smallest proportion in this pie chart?
VPR.A: The crop with the smallest proportion is {Soybeans}.

VE.Q: What is the value of the Barley slice in this pie chart?
VE.A: The value of the Barley slice is {18}%.

VE.Q: What is the value of the Cotton slice in this pie chart?
VE.A: The value of the Cotton slice is {17}%.

SC.Q: What is the difference between the values of Rice and Soybeans in this pie chart?
SC.A: The difference between Rice and Soybeans is {7}%.

SC.Q: What is the sum of the values of Barley and Wheat in this pie chart?
SC.A: The sum of Barley and Wheat is {32}%.

NF.Q: Which categories in the pie chart exceed 18.0%? Please list the category names and corresponding percentages.

NC.Q: Which is smaller, the value of Oats, Barley, or Cotton?

NC.A: The value of {Rice} is the largest.

MSR.Q: How many sectors have a percentage between 3% and 15%?
MSR.A: There are {2} sectors that have a percentage between 3% and 15%.

MSR.Q: Which three sectors have a sum of percentage less than 45%? List all possible combinations.
MSR.A: The possible combinations are: {(Cotton, Wheat, Soybeans)}.
